intro: Cymbicarpos christianus, commonly known as the red sandrat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, fleshy, red berries that remain on the plant throughout the winter, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, dry environments. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces a unique, aromatic scent. Cymbicarpos christianus is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
